addressleaf.section:
Copie of my L. T
re
r l
re
to my. 24 Sep
t
95

page.lettertext:
fol.27r
S
r
. In my coming hitherward to
e
Court
uppon Monday
last, I receaved yo
r
l
res
dated at
e
Hage
e 11 of this
moneth, which after I had read and perused, my
L. of
Essex
sent to me yo
r
latter l
res
, w
t
a Spanish misticall
conceyt in Frenche, tending to persuade a peace, or at
least a surceance or a truce, w
ch
I perceave yow
required my L. to co
m
unicat unto me, as he did; where-
upon yesterday I acquainted her
Ma
tie
both your l
res
and
e Frenche project, w
ch
her Ma
tie
read her selfe,
and upon some debating of
e principall mater comit-
ted to your charge, to w
ch
as yet you had receaved
no answear from
e States, by reason of
e absence of
e
Councell of Estate
being at
e Campe, her Ma
tie
heerw
t
seemed to be still discontented, in
at you had
not pressed to receave an answear according to
e
charge given you. But therein it was apparant
e
fault not to be in you, and yet her Ma
tie
continuing
still her earnest purpose to have an answear (w
th
-
out being satisfied of
e cause of
e delay) hath
co
m
aunded me to write expressely to you in her
name, to presse
e States to give her Ma
tie
a re-
solut answear to her demaundes, and in no wise
to send any persons hither, as you conceyve they
mynde to doe, to give her Ma
tie
answear, with pretence
to renew
e Treatie, w
ch
her Ma
tie
mindeth no
way to doe, And in this sorte her mynde is you
shall proceede wthout recyeving any dilatorie answer
from them, and
e same, to send without returning
your selfe untill her further direction.
The french writing can not be intended, to be noti-
fied, either to
e States there or to us, or to
France,
for
at
e very scope of it is, as I doe marke it in
sondry places to abuse us all three w
t
a mater of
truce or surseance, imagining first to separate
us a sunder, and then to chasten some and bridle
others. At
e tyme of
e writing heere of I was
advertised from
Calais
of 2 Companies of Hollanders,
Conteyning onely 200
at came upon Saturday last
thither; and for other good newes it is bruted
the garrison of Arde, and
e Contrie thereabouts
made a Roade into
Flanders
as farre as
Betune,
fol.27v
and brought from thence a great bootie of sheepe and
other Cattail, and 25 prisoners, whereof
e worst
was worth 500 Crownes. The Gouvernor also
of
Cambray
w
th
Mons
r
Devicks gouvernor of S
t
Denis issued out of
e towne, and slewe 3000 men
and brought 4 peeces of Canon from
e enemie into
e Towne, These be
e lastest newes I have. And
so having no other mater at this p
nt
, I wishe
you to get some suche answear as might satisfie
her Ma
tie
.
And so I bidde you hartelie farewell
From
e Court
at
Nonsuche the 24 of Sep
t
1595
